content.description: Climb the left side of the east face, just right of the arete, and finish on the east pinnacle.
content.protection: May be bouldered or top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.

content.description: Climb the center of the east face above the chopped tree trunk.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but may be top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.

content.description: From the base of the tree climb up and left on the face, finishing well left of the double-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Usually top-roped by slinging a tree and the double-bolt anchor. As the name of the climb implies, a fall while bouldering would be painful.

content.description: Climb the narrow west face at the left end of the formation.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but can be top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.

content.description: Climb the arete on the right edge of the east face at the right end of the formation.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but may be top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.

content.description:
Climb the face left of the main vertical crack on the south face. Harder (5.11c / V2) if you go straight up, easier (5.11b / V2) if you finish on the arete to the right.

VARIATION

No Pain No Gain 5.12a / V4: sit start.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but can be top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.

content.description:
Sit start at the right edge of the east face, stay low while traversing left to the west face, finish at the top. Various portions of the face can be traversed at an easier grade from left to right.

VARIATIONS

Free Will 5.12b / V5: traverse below the small ledge on the left end of the south face.

Booty 5.11d / V3: sit start left of arete at right edge of the south face, traverse right and finish on the arete on the right edge of the east face.

Climb the large vertical crack in the south face.

VARIATIONS

Monster Magnet 5.10c / V0: sit start.

Mango 5.10d / V0+: hand traverse across the ledge on the left and finish on the left arete.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but can be top-roped by slinging trees.

content.description:
Climb the arete between the west face and south face near the left end of the formation.

VARIATIONS

Monkey Poo 5.11a / V1: sit start.

Tango 5.10d / V1: halfway up hand traverse to the right and finish on arete above the big vertical crack.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but can be top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.

content.description: Climb the short arete just right of the large vertical crack and left of the tree on the south face.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but may be top-roped by using the double-bolt anchor and slinging a tree.

content.description: Climb the right side of the east face, just left of the arete.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but may be top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.

content.description: Start 6 feet right of the tree at the base of the south face and climb straight up, finishing just right of the double-bolt anchor.
content.protection: May be bouldered or top-roped from the double-bolt anchor, which can be backed up by slinging a tree. Has been led by placing a small cam in a horizontal crack halfway up.

content.description: Start just left of the arete at the right edge of the south face and diagonal up and left, avoiding the big ledge above and finishing on Footloose. Easier (5.11c / V2) if you climb straight up to the ledge.
content.protection: May be bouldered or top-roped from by using the double-bolt anchor and slinging a tree.

content.description: Start 1 foot to the right of the tree and climb straight up to the top, finishing just left of the double-bolt anchor.
content.protection: May be bouldered or top-roped from the double-bolt anchor, which can be backed up by slinging a tree. Has been led by placing a small cam in a horizontal crack halfway up.

content.description: Climb the short arete on the right edge of the south face.
content.protection: Usually bouldered but can be top-roped by slinging a hangerless bolt and a tree.
